description: Donald Trump’s choice to head the CIA called for the agency to heighten its focus on threats from China, and his nominee for attorney general stood by a call to investigate “bad” prosecutors as the Senate picked up the pace of cabinet confirmation hearings.
title: Trump Nominees Defend Views: Key Takeaways From Senate Hearings

description: Canada has drawn up an initial list of C$150 billion ($105 billion) of US-manufactured items that it would hit with tariffs if President-elect Donald Trump decides to levy tariffs against Canadian goods, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Canada Readies Tariffs on $105 Billion of US Products If Trump Hits First

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior correspondent Saleha Mohsin reviews Scott Bessent’s journey to being nominated as Treasury secretary. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: How Scott Bessent Straddles MAGA World and Wall Street

description: New Zealand, Australian and US dairy companies are accusing Canada of dumping low-priced milk products on world markets and have asking their governments to intervene.
title: Canada Accused by Rival Dairy Exporters of Dumping Milk Products

description: Donald Trump’s nominee to be the top US diplomat signaled that the president-elect is likely to reverse President Joe Biden’s decision Tuesday to remove Cuba from a list of state sponsors of terrorism after he takes office next week.
title: Rubio Signals Trump Is Likely to Return Cuba to Terrorism List

description: Donald Trump confirmed his interest in acquiring Greenland for the US, Denmark’s Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen said following a 45-minute phone call with the incoming US president on Wednesday.
title: Trump Discussed Greenland Interest in Call With Danish Leader

description: Donald Trump’s secretary of state-nominee Marco Rubio said the US should reconsider Chevron Corp.’s sanctions waiver that allows the oil giant to operate in Venezuela.
title: Rubio Says US Should Reconsider Chevron’s Oil Deal in Venezuela

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy signaled the war that has ravaged his country is more likely to end this year because of US President-elect Donald Trump’s sway over Russia.
title: Zelenskiy Sees Higher Chance of War in Ukraine Ending in 2025

description: Apple Inc. CEO Tim Cook is planning to attend the inauguration of President-elect Donald Trump next week, the latest in a wave of Silicon Valley leaders traveling to Washington for the ceremony.
title: Apple’s Tim Cook Plans to Join Tech CEOs at Trump’s Inauguration

description: Massive wildfires that incinerated broad swaths of Los Angeles are offering an early window into how President-elect Donald Trump plans to govern — and how Democrats eager to counter him intend to deal with the Republican.
title: Los Angeles Wildfires Test How Democrats Aim to Counter Trump

description: Canada wants its allies to explore a pricing floor for critical minerals to address what it views as market interference from China, the dominant supplier of metals key to the energy transition.
title: Canada Wants G-7 Talks on Metals Pricing to Counter China’s Sway

description: Gabon’s military leader, Brice Oligui Nguema, has picked a new economy minister to resolve the central African oil producer’s debt woes.
title: Oil-Rich Gabon Picks New Economy Minister to Tackle Debt Woes

description: The deal is a first and fragile step toward ending the war.
title: After the Ceasefire: What’s Next for Israel and Gaza?

description: Chile Labor Minister Jeannette Jara said the government reached a deal with the opposition on some points for a long-awaited pension reform that would boost savings underpinning the nation’s capital markets.
title: Chile Official Says There’s Deal on Some Parts of Pension Reform

description: Since Russia’s full-scale invasion, the UK gained a reputation for being one of the biggest advocates for aggressive support for Ukraine. But under Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s tenure, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy’s administration and its supporters have grown increasingly concerned about Britain’s more cautious approach.
title: Starmer’s Caution on Ukraine Risks Loss of Clout Ahead of Trump

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and the premiers of Canada’s provinces are in high-stakes talks over how far to go in using oil and other commodities as a weapon if the US starts a regional trade war.
title: Trudeau, Canada’s Premiers Spar Over Using Resources as Trade Weapon

description: A long-awaited tender to upgrade a major waterway that ships crops worth tens of billions of dollars a year to global markets is coming under fierce criticism, including from two suitors that accuse Argentina’s government of favoring the current contractor.
title: Milei Government Accused of Skewing Auction to Upgrade Soy River

description: President-elect Donald Trump’s nominee to lead the US Transportation Department said he’d review penalties imposed by aviation regulators on SpaceX if confirmed to the role.
title: Trump Transport Nominee Says He’ll Review FAA’s SpaceX Penalties

description: Keir Starmer’s office insisted the prime minister was still committed to ending revolving-door relationships between government and business after appointing a former financial industry lobbyist to oversee the very firms she represented as recently as last year.
title: Starmer Defends Naming Ex-Banks Lobbyist to City of London Job

description: A bipartisan group of senators complained the Biden administration is rushing as it leaves office to complete binding side deals in key trade agreements, giving up crucial leverage to address grievances of US industries such as fishing, dairy and digital services.
title: Senators Complain Biden Administration Rushing Trade Deals

description: Israel and Hamas agreed to a ceasefire deal, bringing a temporary halt to the war in the Gaza Strip that has killed tens of thousands of people in the last 15 months and touched off broader turmoil across the Middle East, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Israel and Hamas Reach Ceasefire Deal After 15 Months of Deadly Conflict

description: China criticized the Biden administration’s flurry of trade restrictions on the country during its final days in office, saying the measures were “irrational and extremely irresponsible” and vowing a further push for self-reliance.
title: China Blasts ‘Irrational’ Biden Trade Curbs, Vows Self-Reliance

description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk accused Russia of planning to carry out “acts of air terror” against airlines worldwide as he urged European partners to join forces in countering Moscow’s alleged sabotage attempts.
title: Poland’s Tusk Says Russia Planned Terror Acts Against Airlines

description: The Biden administration took action Wednesday to make it harder for President-elect Donald Trump to lift some sanctions on Russia, in a parting shot days before the new team takes over.
title: Biden Administration Hardens Russia Sanctions Before Departing

description: President-elect Donald Trump’s pick to lead the US Justice Department said her “overriding objective” if confirmed “would be to return the Department of Justice to its core mission of keeping Americans safe and vigorously enforcing the law.”
title: Bondi Pledges ‘One Tier of Justice’ as Attorney General

description: The top Republican and Democrat on the Senate Foreign Relations Committee joined in praising Marco Rubio at the Florida senator’s nomination hearing for secretary of state, signaling he’ll face one of the easiest confirmations of President-elect Donald Trump’s cabinet.
title: Rubio Faces Friendly Colleagues in Hearing for Top US Diplomat

description: The Central Intelligence Agency must heighten its focus on the threats posed by China and expand the volume of intelligence that officers collect around the world, President-elect Donald Trump’s choice to lead the spy service told a Senate confirmation hearing.
title: Trump’s Pick to Lead CIA Wants Better Intelligence on China

description: More than two centuries of British control over the Chagos islands are set to end, with the UK preparing to hand ownership of the Indian Ocean archipelago to Mauritius.
title: A Guide to the UK’s Pending Chagos Deal With Mauritius

description: French Prime Minister Francois Bayrou pledged to bring proposed changes to the pension law to parliament, even if all parties don’t agree on the alterations, aiming to go far enough toward a key demand of Socialists to get their tacit support.
title: French Premier Open to New Pension Law in Bid for Support

description: Russia will demand Ukraine drastically cut back military ties with the NATO alliance and become a neutral state with a limited army in any talks with incoming US President Donald Trump, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Putin Would Demand Ukraine Never Join NATO in Any Trump Talks

description: Ireland’s two dominant political parties will return to power for another five-year term after agreeing a new coalition deal following weeks of negotiations.
title: Ireland’s Centrist Parties Seal Coalition Deal to Retain Power

description: Kosovo’s government shut down more than two dozen Serb-run institutions on its territory, risking a potential flare-up in tensions in the Balkan nation less than four weeks before it holds a parliamentary election.
title: Kosovo Shuts Serb Institutions, Fueling Tension Ahead of Vote

description: Switzerland’s defense minister and former president Viola Amherd announced her resignation, voicing criticism of increased polarization in political discourse.
title: Swiss Defense Minister Resigns, Citing Polarization in Politics

description: Germany’s armed forces and defense ministry said they’re suspending activity on their accounts on Elon Musk’s social-media platform X due to what they called increasing difficulty with “the objective exchange of arguments.”
title: German Army, Defense Ministry Suspend Posts on Musk’s X Platform

description: The European Union asked member states to review investments by their companies in non-EU countries in sensitive sectors like semiconductors and artificial intelligence.
title: EU Asks for Risk Assessments of Chip, AI, Quantum Investments

description: Poland will seek to accelerate talks on Ukraine’s membership in the European Union during its current six-month rotating presidency in the bloc, Prime Minister Donald Tusk said on Wednesday.
title: Poland to Speed Up Ukraine’s EU Accession Talks, Tusk Says

description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer said Rachel Reeves will be Britain’s finance minister for “many years to come,” his strongest backing yet for his chancellor in the wake of market turmoil hitting UK assets that has put her position in the spotlight.
title: Starmer Says Reeves to Be UK Chancellor for ‘Many Years to Come’

description: Thailand’s House of Representatives passed a bill to promote liquor production by small entrepreneurs, a move Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra said will help unshackle the monopoly in the nation’s alcoholic beverage industry and support the rural economy.
title: Thailand’s Lower House Passes Bill to Free Up Liquor Production

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: An Israel-Hamas Deal Poses Dilemmas All Round

description: South Korean investigators managed to arrest impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol on Wednesday while avoiding a violent clash in the middle of Seoul. But the nation’s troubles are far from over.
title: President’s Arrest Shows South Korea in Peril as Trump Returns

description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s cabinet passed legislation that will enable Germany’s armed forces to shoot down unidentified drones suspected of spying on military bases, industrial facilities and other critical infrastructure.
title: Scholz’s Cabinet Authorizes Military to Shoot Down Drones

description: Do immigrants really take jobs from Americans? And does more immigration really mean lower wages? Here’s a no-nonsense guide to one of the country’s most divisive issues.
title: How Immigration Affects the US Economy

description: Bulgaria’s center-right party moved to break an impasse as it proposed a coalition government, offering the Balkan nation the chance at a functioning majority to tackle issues such as corruption and euro adoption.
title: Bulgaria Moves Ahead With Cabinet to End Political Deadlock

description: Italy, the United Arab Emirates and Albania will work together on a joint project to transport electricity from Albania to Italy via an undersea cable in the Adriatic, Premier Giorgia Meloni said in Abu Dhabi on Wednesday.
title: Italy, UAE, Albania Sign €1 Billion Deal for Subsea Energy Cable

description: The Treasury secretary nominee cultivated allies in Trump’s orbit who have come to see him as a brainy avatar of their vision.
title: How Scott Bessent Won Over MAGA and Wall Street

description: President Joe Biden will cast his presidency as an economic turnaround in his farewell address to the nation, looking to define his legacy after his party’s election defeat and as polls show his popularity at fresh lows.
title: Biden to Tout Job Growth, Legacy in Farewell Address Before Trump Return

description: Donald Trump’s choice to lead the US Transportation Department plans to tell lawmakers that he’ll cut red tape slowing big infrastructure projects if confirmed for the role, according to remarks he’s set to deliver during a Senate hearing on Wednesday.
title: Trump’s Transport Pick Vows to Cut Red Tape, Prioritize Safety

description: Outgoing Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen fiercely defended the Biden administration’s policy choices, highlighting the strength of the US economy relative to its major peers, to its past performance and to gloomier economist forecasts.
title: Yellen Touts Strong US Economy in Praise of Biden’s Policies

description: Philippine prosecutors are seeking money laundering charges against a former town mayor over her alleged involvement in an online casino project.
title: Philippines Seeks Money Laundering Charges Against Ex-Mayor

description: Israel and Hamas accused one another of delaying a Gaza ceasefire aimed at exchanging hostages for prisoners and sending aid to the beleaguered Palestinian territory.
title: Israel, Hamas Trade Accusations for Delaying Gaza Ceasefire Deal

description: Taiwan’s companies invested a record amount of money in the US and Japan last year while the figure for China stagnated — highlighting supply-chain shifts resulting from worsening cross-strait ties.
title: Taiwan Investments in US, Japan Surge as China Figure Stagnates

description: War is the top worry wracking the nerves of risk experts surveyed by the World Economic Forum, despite incoming US President Donald Trump’s vow to end hostilities in Ukraine.
title: War Anxiety Grips Davos Experts With Ukraine Peace Still Elusive

description: Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis named Constantine Tassoulas, the speaker of the Parliament, as his choice for the new president of the Hellenic Republic.
title: Greece’s PM Names Parliament Speaker as Candidate for President

description: Norway’s ruling Labor Party that’s lagged behind opposition Progress Party in recent months, drew closer to its opponent in the latest poll published by public broadcaster NRK, suggesting a tighter contest in the parliamentary vote due in September.
title: Norway Ruling Party Recoups Lost Support in Latest NRK Poll

description: India’s state refiners are rushing to speed up payments for Russian crude, hoping to complete their trades before a dramatic expansion of Washington’s curbs on Moscow’s oil industry effectively comes into force next month, people familiar with the matter said.
title: India Rushes to Pay for Russian Oil Ahead of Sanctions Cutoff

description: Support for German Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s Social Democrats and the opposition conservatives strengthened in a new poll, while the far-right Alternative for Germany party held steady.
title: Scholz’s SPD, Merz’s Conservatives Gain in German Election Poll

description: France’s government aims to achieve €53 billion ($54.6 billion) of savings as part of its plans to narrow the country’s deficit, according to Budget Minister Amelie de Montchalin.
title: French Minister Says Government Targets €53 Billion of Savings

description: Ukraine said it came under a massive Russian missile attack on Wednesday morning that forced emergency power cuts across large swathes of the country.
title: Ukraine Suffers Power Cuts Following Russian Missile Strike

description: China and the Philippines are holding talks on their South China Sea dispute, Manila’s top envoy said Wednesday, as tensions rise anew over Beijing’s giant vessel in disputed waters.
title: China, Philippines Hold Talks as ‘Monster’ Ship Fuels South China Sea Tensions

description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.’s satisfaction rating tumbled in December to its lowest since he started his term in 2022, according to a Social Weather Stations survey.
title: Philippine Marcos’ Rating Falls to Lowest in December Poll

description: Cherie Blair, the human rights lawyer and wife of former UK Prime Minister Tony Blair, will issue a rallying cry for women to have a louder voice in politics after female representation barely advanced in last year’s international elections and as female public figures globally faced increased threats of violence.
title: Economy May Grow 20% With Female Participation, World Bank Says

description: Native Russian speakers, who make up almost 30% of Estonia’s population, have found themselves in the government’s crosshairs.
title: Push to Stamp Out Russian Influence in Europe Leaves Scars

description: The US president-elect gave Netanyahu and his cabinet a binary choice to sign on or alienate his administration. It worked.
title: Gaza Ceasefire Deal Is a Win for Trump

description: Doubling down on the country’s strong regulatory leadership on AI would be smarter than chasing a vague and uncertain industrial policy.
title: Britain’s Keir Starmer Needs to Curb His AI Enthusiasm

description: The European Union is prepared to make sure carmakers are ready to meet its 2035 goal to effectively phase out the combustion engine, the bloc’s climate chief said, despite stiff competition from China.
title: EU Climate Chief Says Carmakers Can Thrive in Global EV Race

description: When Daniel Chapo is sworn in as Mozambique’s new president on Wednesday, he’ll take over as the leader of a nation shattered by months of protests that have claimed hundreds of lives and crippled the economy — and many people who don’t consider him legitimately elected.
title: Mozambique to Inaugurate New President in Shadow of Disputed Vote

description: Spain’s plans to discourage foreigners from buying residential property will likely hit resort towns and developers of luxury homes, but will do little to overcome the housing shortage that’s squeezing locals.
title: Sanchez Scapegoating UK Buyers Won’t Fix Spanish Housing Woes

description: At least sixteen state-run TV channels have ceased broadcasting in Vietnam amid a government-wide push to slash bureaucracy, a reform program that will eventually leave just one national station on air.
title: Vietnam State-Run TV Channels Taken Off Air as Reforms Kick In

description: Thailand’s cabinet this week approved changes to the nation’s visa rules to make it more attractive for skilled professionals, investors and wealthy foreigners to secure long-term residency permits.
title: Thailand Eases Visa Rules for Professionals, Wealthy Foreigners

description: The legal perils of South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol escalated on Jan. 15 when investigators arrested him for questioning over his short-lived martial law declaration. The country’s parliament had already impeached him on Dec. 14 after lawmakers judged his declaration violated the constitution. Yoon has been stripped of his presidential powers and awaits a verdict on whether he will be removed from office.
title: All About South Korean President Yoon’s Legal Perils After His Arrest

description: South Korean investigators arrested President Yoon Suk Yeol on Wednesday after launching a pre-dawn operation to bring the impeached leader in for questioning over his short-lived martial law declaration.
title: South Korean President Yoon Arrested Over Martial Law Fiasco

description: President-elect Donald Trump’s incoming national security advisor said the soon-to-be administration was already working on a number of priorities, but singled out the “open nature” of the US southern border as the one that requires immediate attention.
title: Waltz Says Southern Border Is Trump Team’s Most Urgent Priority

description: Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said the monthslong dispute over gas distribution rights in Sarawak between Petroliam Nasional Bhd. and the Borneo state has been resolved, Bernama reported.
title: Anwar Says Dispute Over Sarawak Gas Rights Resolved: Bernama
